data.title: Batch audio converter
data.meta_description: I'm looking for something that will do batch audio conversions. When you download a sample pack and all the files are in AIFF, I want something that I...
data.text:
I'm looking for something that will do batch audio conversions. When you download a sample pack and all the files are in AIFF, I want something that I can drag and drop the folder (or navigate to it in the browser) and ideally it will create a set of folders in the same structure and populate it with the converted files.

Ideally, it would be free and open source, but it's more important that it works and works well.

Does such a thing exist? What are you using to accomplish these conversions?

An additional question: when I'm browsing sample files in Ableton, sometimes it will give me a preview of the audio, and sometimes it won't. They'll all open in Ableton and play just fine once I load them into the app -- either as audio or into the Simpler. It's just that I don't get an audio preview in the browser. I've got half a notion that this tends to happen to files that I've converted myself. Any hints? Am I doing something wrong? Is it a bit rate issue? I'm really unclear as to why people use different bit rates anyway. What bitrate should I be using and why?

Myself I use MediaCoder.

For years. The product exists since 2005. I use it since that year.

It is freeware.

Windows, OSX, Ipad, PSP, etc. There is also a portable edition.

32-bit and 64-bit.

Features In Brief

Converting between most popular audio and video formats

H.264/H.265 GPU accelerated encoding (QuickSync, NVENC, CUDA)

Ripping BD/DVD/VCD/CD and capturing from video cameras

Enhancing audio and video contents by various filters

An extremely rich set of transcoding parameters for adjusting and tuning

Multi-threaded design and parallel filtering unleashing multi-core power

Segmental Video Encoding technology for improved parallelization

Multilanguage

Typical Applications

Improving compression / reducing size for audio and video files

Converting media content for playback on multimedia devices

Converting media content for online publication or broadcasting

Unifying and normalizing media standard and storage format

Extracting audio track from video files and discs

Dumping and encoding from network stream or capture device

Fixing corrupted or partial downloaded video files

Supported Fomats

Lossy Audio Compression Formats

MP3, Vorbis, LC-AAC, HE-AAC, Opus, AC-3, MPEG Audio, MusePack, Speex, AMR, Windows Media Audio, ADPCM, mp3PRO

Lossless Audio Compression Formats

FLAC, WavPack, Monkey's Audio, OptimFrog, ALAC, TTA, PCM

Video Compression Formats

H.264/AVC, H.265/HEVC, VP8/VP9, MPEG 1/2/4, Flash Video, XviD, DivX, Theora, Dirac, H.263, RealVideo, Windows Media Video, Huffyuv, MJPEG

Container Formats

MP4, WebM, F4V, FLV, Matroska, AVI, MPEG-PS, MPEG-TS, ASF, MTS/M2TS/AVCHD, Quicktime/MOV, PMP, RealMedia, OGM

Storage Media and Streaming (Input)

Bluray, DVD, VCD, SVCD, CD, CUESheet, HTTP, FTP, RTSP, UDP

If you use the built-in wizard in the toolbar you just have to define the output format and that's it. Otherwise the tool offers endless possibilities.

The website :

MediaCoder - more than a universal audio/video transcoder - MediaCoder official website

The download page for the full edition and the portable edition

MediaCoder - Download Latest MediaCoder

Pages of other editions (there is even an edition for PSP)

MediaCoder - Choose Your MediaCoder Edition

Some screenshots :

​

And there is also a simplified edition focused only on audio formats, named AudioCoder :

Supported Audio Fomats and Codecs

Lossy Audio Compression Formats

MP3, Vorbis, LC-AAC, HE-AAC, Opus, AC-3, MPEG Audio, MusePack, Speex, AMR, Windows Media Audio, ADPCM

Lossless Audio Compression Formats

FLAC, WavPack, Monkey's Audio, OptimFrog, ALAC, TTA, PCM

Integrated Audio Codecs

LAME MP3

OggEnc (Vorbis Encoder)

Nero AAC Encoder

QAAC (using Apple's CoreAAC encoding engine)

CT AAC+ Encoder

Opus Audio Encoder

FAAC

Enhanced 3GGP AAC+ Encoder

Helix MP3 Encoder

MusePack SV8 Encoder

Speex Encoder

WavPack Encoder

FLAC Encoder

Monkey's Audio Codec 4.0

TTA Encoder

OptimFrog Encoder

MPEG-4 Lossless Encoder

Features

Super fast parallelized audio transcoding

Encodes to most popular audio formats

Both audio and video input supported

BD/DVD/CD & streaming input supported

2-pass normalization in batch

Tagging and formatted file naming

CUE sheet and M3U playlist support

Interesting x 1

Love it! x 1

List

Myriad is probably the best of them, but now that Zynaptiq owns it, its iLok protected and you have to drop $500 and buy their whole bundle of crap apps they bought from the developer just to get the batch converter. I used to use AIMP here, but Myriad one upped it with all its options. You can convert everything and put it all in a new spot, or you can simply overwrite the 'old' stuff and it will save all the new files right on top of the old ones. There's your folder structure and everything still intact (Just remember to empty the trash when you're done, Myriad throws it all there when it's finished).

Whichever one you pick, you can compare how well apps actually do conversion here, https://src.infinitewave.ca/

Some of them are pretty bad at it, its one of the reasons I steered clear of Amadeus on the Mac.. Even the almighty Barbabatch has a little bit of 'noise' in its conversion (Look at how much Apples CoreAudio improved between Tiger and Leopard too).

I thought I'd check this one out so I went to their website to take a look. OK, its paid software but how much can it cost? $10? $20?

Nope, $260. Fortunately, my ears just aren't that good. (Also, there's an R2R upload on sister site.)

Agree x 1
